reviewText: I watched them before I bought  it.  It isn't right to have only volume 1 or 2.  Flying Down to Rio is the first film.  I was sad it wasn't on volume one. It's a great film with Delores Del Rio and awesome acrobatics on a plane.  Really enjoyable.Roberta is odd, no lie, but it has good moments.Carefree is still missing :( so my Astaire/Rodgers collection is not complete.  Still looking for this film.  That one is great too.Follow the Fleet has some really great moments. . . . all their films do really.  Definitely worth a shot if you haven't seen any.
Title: TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers Volume Two (Roberta / Follow the Fleet / Flying Down to Rio / The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle)

reviewText: I'm pretty much copying the content of my review of volume one of this set in that I praise that one and pretty much have a so-so assessment of this one.TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers (The Gay Divorcee / Top Hat / Swing Time / Shall We Dance)is essential for someone who doesn't really know this dancing duo that well. This volume is really for the completist. "Flying Down to Rio" and "Roberta" don't even star the pair. Gene Raymond and Delores del Rio star in the 1933 precode "Flying Down to Rio" and Ginger and Fred are fourth and fifth billed feuding - and dancing - members of an American troupe that is performing in Rio. Its main virtue is that it is a precode and therefore some of the lines and situations are priceless. "Roberta" stars RKO's queen of the lot at the time - Irene Dunne - and Randolph Scott before he found his niche in westerns. It's a good romantic comedy, but just don't expect too much of Fred and Ginger. "The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle" is the last film the duo did together for RKO and is ironic because, if the Castles are remembered at all today, it is because Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers played them in a movie. Plus, because the two are happily married in the film, you're missing all of the fun of the misunderstandings, squabbling, and sexual tension of their other RKO starring vehicles. "Follow the Fleet" stands alone in this set as one of the best that Astaire and Rogers did together. There's lots of great music and a good supporting cast. It's just too bad that in this second volume that there wasn't room for "Carefree", since it is one of the few films in which the plot has Ginger putting one over on Fred rather than vice versa.If you are really that big of an Astaire/Rogers completist maybe you should considerAstaire & Rogers Ultimate Collector's Edition (Flying Down to Rio / The Gay Divorcee / Roberta / Top Hat / Follow the Fleet / Swing Time / Shall We Dance / Carefree / The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle / The Barkleys of Broadway). It's been around long enough that it is usually always on sale somewhere and it is much more durably packaged than these Greatest Films Collections tend to be.
Title: TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers Volume Two (Roberta / Follow the Fleet / Flying Down to Rio / The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle)

reviewText: Fred and Ginger simply the best. My hat comes off for Ginger, everything Fred did, she did backwards and on high heels, what a dame!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: I bought this one for a relative, though, I enjoy them too.  I prefer these to the volume one selections, as they are all nearly the same film just different details.  These are four individually unique films.  So I'd recommend this one first before the first one.  We own both and likely this one will get used more often.

Title: TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers Volume Two (Roberta / Follow the Fleet / Flying Down to Rio / The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle)

reviewText: This is another great collection, although not as good as Volume I.  Follow the Fleet is the real gem here, and worth the price alone, but includes other worthy contributions.  Amazon advertises this with no features and in "color"... there are comedy shorts, theatrical trailers, and all four movies are black and white (which is an important feature for true classic movie fans). A great addition to any classic movie collection.
Title: TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers Volume Two (Roberta / Follow the Fleet / Flying Down to Rio / The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle)

reviewText: This is one of two TCM collections of their films, I own them both....this is a great collection at a great price!

reviewText: Not bad, but mostly in black and white.  Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers are not the featured stars in the one movie we watched so far.  I have to say that some of the other Fred Astaire DVD's are better overall.
Title: TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers Volume Two (Roberta / Follow the Fleet / Flying Down to Rio / The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle)

reviewText: You just don't get any better than Astaire and Rogers and this collection of four of their best is wonderful.  Very affordable and they have many extras.  I also enjoyed seeing a very young blonde Lucille Ball in two of the films, Roberta where she plays a model but gets no billing, and Follow the Fleet she plays Kitty Collins.  The dancing is so amazing at one point, my husband was watching and said, 'let's see them try that on 'Dancing with the Stars.'  Films of the thirties are a passion of mine, and this is a great way to round out my collection.  You can't go wrong.  I am so happy TCM collections are making these fabulous films available for a more affordable price.
summary: Talke about a treasure of films!
Title: TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers Volume Two (Roberta / Follow the Fleet / Flying Down to Rio / The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle)

reviewText: Three of the four movies are not among the more well known of the Astaire/Rogers collaboration, but they are nevertheless wonderful to watch, and the music is memorable.  The fourth movie is the first of the Astaire/Rogers pairing:  Flying Down to Rio.  It's a joy to watch and has wonderful tunes.  The collection is a must buy !
summary: Astaire and Rogers Shine, As Usual
Title: TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers Volume Two (Roberta / Follow the Fleet / Flying Down to Rio / The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle)

reviewText: I can't believe you can get these four disc sets of such great old classics for such a low price! These films are timeless classics that are as entertaining today as the days they were filmed!  Fred & Ginger were absutely stunning as a dance couple & they still never fail to entertain!
Title: TCM Greatest Classic Film Collection: Astaire & Rogers Volume Two (Roberta / Follow the Fleet / Flying Down to Rio / The Story of Vernon and Irene Castle)

reviewText: Fred and Ginger, there still going! What a great collection to own! Movies are clear and wonderful sound! If you love them both then you need to have this! Cheers! William
